item.title: Claudette Colvin, who refused to move seats on a bus at start of civil rights movement, dies
item.description: Civil rights pioneer Claudette Colvin has died. She was 86. Her 1955 arrest for refusing to give up her seat on a segregated Montgomery bus helped spark the modern civil rights movement.

item.title: Republicans say Clintons risk contempt of Congress for not testifying on Epstein
item.description: House Republicans are seeking testimony as part of their investigation into convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein. The Clintons say they've already provided in writing what little they know.

item.description: Federal officials say a company that operates hundreds of landing pages for AI answers is running an operation that has duped thousands of users, who were unable to stop costly monthly charges.

item.title: 'My role was making movies that mattered,' says Jodie Foster, as 'Taxi Driver' turns 50
item.description: Foster was just 12 years old when she starred in the 1976 film. "What luck to have been part of that, our golden age of cinema in the '70s," she says. Her latest film is Vie Privée (A Private Life).

item.title: Scott Adams, the controversial cartoonist behind 'Dilbert,' dies at 68
item.description: Adams announced in May that he was dying of metastatic prostate cancer. Thousands of newspapers carried his strip satirizing office culture from the '90s until a controversy in 2023.
